title: Logistic growth differential equation in cafeteria

content.prompt: The number of students in a cafeteria is modeled by the function P that satisfies the logistic differential equation  dP dt = 1 2000 P( 200âˆ’P ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@456A@ , where t is the time in seconds and P(0) = 25. What is the greatest rate of change, in students per second, of the number of students in the cafeteria?

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
